abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Water Supply and Sanitation
            Project in Yemen, presents no major environmental concerns;
            nonetheless, this Summary of the Environmental Review,
            presented as an annex to the Appraisal Report, focuses on
            wastewater, and excreta disposal, sludge, and effluents
            reuse, and disposal, sanitary protection of wells and
            bore-holes, water testing and surveillance, solid wastes
            disposal, and storm water drainage. The mitigation plan
            include: 1) soil inspection, and assessment of groundwater
            depths to prevent contamination. Additionally, installation
            of latrines, or septic tanks, should only be located at a
            distance of at least fifty meters from the well, or
            bore-hole, and, equipment, and training for water testing
            should be provided; 2) the use of waste water will only be
            used for crops irrigation, following a careful testing to
            ensure compliance with the World Bank, and the World Health
            Organization (WHO) standards; 3) similarly, dried sludge -
            as soil fertilizer - will only be sold to farmers, following
            compliance with WHO standards, and, a formal policy will be
            developed for sludge reuse, and disposal. Communities will
            be informed, and trained for an active participation in the
            environmental aspects of the project.
